name: The St. Regis Washington, D.C.

reviews.text: Family of four stayed three nights after Christmas. This is a very nice, small hotel. Nice, not luxurious and the price (250/night) reflected that. The location is excellent as one can walk to the White House and spend little in cabs going to the museums in the mall. I would be back.
reviews.title: Well located, nice but not luxurious

reviews.text: Love this St. Regis hotel. Conveniently located near the White House, restaurants and several subway stops. I must say it has certainly an old and traditional feel to it, yet very luxurious.
reviews.title: "A truly fabulous stay !"

reviews.text: The bar has been recently renovated and it definitely showed. I remember the bar being rather dark, but to my surprise it has transformed into this modern and contemporary looking St. Regis bar.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel

reviews.text: This time I travelled to DC for business and had few hours left to do some sightseeing. I really wanted to get the most out of the rest of the day so I asked the Concierge for a couple of recommendations for a city tour. Jair the Concierge who seemed to work the Concierge desk 24/7 was wonderful. He provided me with some great tour options and I decided to go with the trolley hop on hop off tour which I can only recommend. Furthermore I needed a place for a quick bite and Jair told me about this fairly new Spanish tapas place near the hotel which was great.
reviews.title: Won over by the staff

reviews.text: Make sure you don't miss the champagne sabering which is a St. Regis hotel tradition and happens everyday at exactly six o'clock. I did not have a chance to try their Adure restaurant for dinner but had breakfast there which was very reasonable, I really enjoyed the pastries and the servers were always very friendly.
reviews.title: Extraordinary Service

reviews.text: It was a disappointment from the moment we pulled up. First, the front desk had only one person in attendance, who seemed distracted and whose suit was not clean. Then we entered the room, #220, and were struck by the two things immediately: the room was not particularly clean, and the bathroom was extraordinarily small and uncomfortable to use----there was absolutely no room for toiletry bags and the shower was dangerous and hard to use, you literally are required to climb up and down a step ladder to access the shower, which is no fun in your 50s, and even less fun when wet and slippery. Additionally, the water pressure was horrible, and we also noticed that we received one bathrobe, not two, and no soap.
reviews.title: This property is a complete embarassment to the St Regis brand

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I called down to the desk, to discuss the bathroom, robe and soap; and was told that a better room may become available the next day. That evening I also attempted to to order tea from the butler only to learn that I did not have butler service, something I thought was part of the St Regis experience.
reviews.title: No..

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Next day, I called Starwood customer service and reported all this; notwithstanding that this was on Starwood's radar, and that I personally spoke an additional 4 or 5 times with the front desk, including in particular Norberto the front desk manager, during in my entire three day stay, I never received soap or a second bathrobe, nor was the room ever properly cleaned. I somewhat expected to find flowers or fruit in my room with an apology note, but instead I was completely ignored.
reviews.title: Elegant/Location,location

reviews.text: On about my 5th call, when Norberto actually said "do you still want me to send you a robe?", I was incredulous, and requested that he comp breakfast for us, and he did. It may be ironic that both mornings, the service was horrendous: waiting 15 minutes for a table to be cleaned and set during peak hours when the restaurant was less than half full, waiting 25 minutes for coffee and tea to arrive, waiting more than 15 minutes for the bill. The woman managing breakfast was beyond frazzled. No one knew what to do first. the food was good, the service extremely poor. And it was not just us---we had other friends who stayed at hotel at our (sad) recommendation: both families also experienced less than satisfactory service, We also met two couples from Houston at the hotel there for the same conference, and they were appalled at the lack of service,
reviews.title: Spacious and Wonderful Location

reviews.text: The list goes on and on. I asked for a New York Times while waiting for a table at the half empty restaurant and the woman manning the entrance did not know what I was talking about--I had to actually explain that it was a newspaper! Then, when we checked out, the bellhops could not locate our car key and we lost another 10-15 minutes. It may also be the only time in my life I checked out of a luxury hotel and no one offered us water for the car trip.
reviews.title: Not impressive

reviews.text: All of my comments are based on my high expectations of the St. Regis brand.
reviews.title: Disappointing St. Regis stay

reviews.text: I am a Lifetime Platinum member and had a recent stay. I found the hotel to be mediocre. When I checked in, there was only one agent at the front desk causing a back up. I was not given any noticeable upgrade though the hotel was full.
reviews.title: Great location and terrific Concierge- could be more quiet

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was fine though definitely small. The first things I noticed was the towels were very worn and rough. I couldn't believe how rough they were given the St. Regis brand/rate paid. Also, even though the room was booked for two people, only one small bottle of water was provided. Again, you'd think a hotel at that price point would provide two bottles of water (one per person).
reviews.title: Elegant hotel steps from the White House

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There was really no explanation of the butler service provided upon check in. On previous stays at other St. Regis, an explanation of benefits was provided (i.e., unpacking service, coffee service, pressing of garments, etc.) at check-in.
reviews.title: Bring Your Own Joe

reviews.text: The gym in the hotel was in the basement was small though the property offered free passes to the gym across the street, Mint. It was frigid when I visited so that was a painful walk.
reviews.title: President of Italy leaving as I was checking in

reviews.text: We took our two girls 8 and 10 to DC for the first time. The hotel was surprisingly kid friendly. The doormen were incredibley helpful and patient as we unloaded the car. As we were checking in the concierge noticed we had children and came over to introduce a very well put together scavenger hunt that took us all over popular sites. It turned out to be a godsend as it kept the kids motivated to do lots of site seeing over a short period of time.....the prize at the end, a dip into the treasure chest. Very clever and much appreciated.
reviews.title: Scavenger Hunt
Romance in the City
reviews.text: My husband and I celebrated a landmark anniversary overnight in Washington, D.C. and our experience at the St. Regis was incomparable! I'd called the hotel directly to make the reservation and was asked if the occasion was a special one. The reservation clerk congratulated me, yet as we were paying a lesser government employee rate, I certainly had no anticipation of an upgrade, but upgraded we were to a deluxe king room. At the hotel, the staff, from the front door to the desk to passing service people in the hall, everyone was friendly, helpful and welcoming. We checked in early, spent the day on the Mall visiting museums and returned in the early evening to find a beautiful and delicious "Happy Anniversary" treat waiting in our room. Check-out held no surprises, just warm thanks and invitations to return. Excellently located, two Metro stations an easy, close walk, the restaurant-rich Dupont Circle area only one stop away, the hotel beautifully maintained with very comfortable rooms, a luxe bathroom and gracious staff ... the St Regis surpassed our greatest expectations.

I traveled for business, but the hotel is centrally located in DC for anyone on vacation. The room was large, and the bathroom was even larger. It was so well-appointed. The attention to detail was impressive. I loved the beautiful book provided courtesy of the stationer located in the hotel and Mont Blanc. The bed was extremely comfortable, as I would expect. Check-in and check-out were highly efficient.
reviews.title: Perfect

reviews.text: I would also recommend a visit to the Adour restaurant. While expensive, it was easily the best meal I have ever had in DC.
reviews.title: Understated Elegance, Extraordinary Staff

reviews.text: From James, the elegant doorman with a friendly greeting, to the very discreet security people who handled noisy neighbors calmly and efficiently to amazingly helpful concierges who went to great lengths to track down a vegan bakery for my niece, every staff member at this hotel is attentive and professional. And let's not forget "Just Plain Jane," as she called herself, who staffs the bar on Sunday evening when the restaurant is closed and serves the customers in a professional and friendly manner. Alena the receptionist made certain a family reunion was very special. It's not often that the staff in hotel impress me so much that I make note of so many names and remember them months later.
reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel in Great Location

aka: The St. Regis Washington, d.c. Hotel
description: No other Washington, D.C. luxury hotel boasts the impeccable location and grandeur of The St. Regis Washington, D.C. Hotel. It is no wonder that every American President has stayed here.
